intro: Nephrodium angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved nephroid, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae, which includes various ferns and related species. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. Its reproductive structures consist of small, spore-bearing sporangia located on the underside of the leaves. Nephrodium angustifolium is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
